title: 107_hr4786
content: The Act may be cited as the "225th Anniversary of the American Revolution Commemoration Act". The American Revolution, inspired by liberty and independence, had a global impact on American Government, laws, culture, and values. The 225th anniversary of the Revolutionary War from 2000 to 2008 is significant. Every generation should understand the Revolution's legacy, and the anniversary is an opportunity to enhance public awareness of its impact on citizens today. The National Park Service aims to establish partnerships to connect sites and programs related to the American Revolution with other entities. A national program is proposed to engage the public through various activities and materials, emphasizing the Revolution's story and significance. The American Revolution is recognized for its enduring importance in American citizens' lives today. The National Park Service is authorized to coordinate activities to commemorate and interpret the Revolution's history and significance. The National Park Service is authorized to coordinate activities for the 225th anniversary of the American Revolution. The Secretary of the Interior will establish the "225th Anniversary of the American Revolution Commemoration" program, which includes producing educational materials, entering cooperative agreements, protecting resources, and enhancing communications. The "225th Anniversary of the American Revolution Commemoration" program aims to enhance communication and collaboration among National Park Service units related to the Revolutionary War, expand research for American Revolution interpretation, and create an official symbol for the theme. It includes all NPS units related to the American Revolution and other sites of educational or interpretive nature directly linked to the Revolution. The Secretary of State coordinates with the Governments of the United Kingdom, France, the Netherlands, Spain, and Canada for the 225th Anniversary of the American Revolution. Cooperative agreements and memoranda of understanding are established with Federal agencies, States, local governments, and private entities to achieve the Act's purposes. Authorization of appropriations is provided for these efforts. Authorization of Appropriations: $500,000 authorized for the Secretary to carry out the Act for fiscal years 2003 through 2008.
